info.description: Use this asynchronous service to import and read master data. It doesn't perform any user-specific authorization checks. Hence, it is the responsibility of the caller of this Master Data Service to ensure that user-specific authorization checks are in place. ## Usage summary The central functionality of this service deals with the import of master data and can be summarized with the following steps: 1. Import data within one import session (see **Service Operations** - **/Import{EntityName}**).\ This call can be made several times per import session.\ **Example:** If you want to import **_products_** and **_product groups_**, then you would have to call **_/ImportProducts_** and **_/ImportProductGroups_** within the same import session and then proceed with the next steps. 2. Finish one import session (see **Service Operations** - **/ProcessImportedData**). 3. *Optional:* Retrieve status of an import session (see **Service Operations** - **/GetDataImportStatus**). [More information on the customizing service is available at the SAP S/4HANA for procurement planning SAP Help Portal page.](https://help.sap.com/viewer/aad8ff6e4e0c404591864a751c877d34/LATEST/en-US/7342f4f270014acfaed5d93401f3b1df.html) ## Rate Limitations This API is rate limited to 1000 requests per hour and 10000 requests per day.
info.title: Master Data for Procurement Planning

x-sap-shortText: This asynchronous service enables you to import and read master data.

externalDocs.description: More general information is available at the SAP S/4HANA for procurement planning SAP Help Portal page.

get.summary: Retrieves entities from Custom Code Lists 1.
get.description: No specific parameters are required, but the standard OData parameters are supported. As response, a list of all custom code lists 1 is returned.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filters items by property values, see [Filtering](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionfilter)

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionorderby)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionselect)

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Expand related entities, see [Expand](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionexpand)
The unique identifier of the entity in form of an unique String
parameters.name: ID

get.summary: Retrieves specific Custom Code Lists 1 using their IDs.
get.description: The ID of the requested custom code list 1 is required as parameter. Additionally, the standard OData parameters are supported. As response, exactly one custom code list 1 is returned. If no custom code list 1 is found in the system with the requested ID, the endpoint returns an appropriate error message.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionselect)

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Expand related entities, see [Expand](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionexpand)

post.summary: Adds Custom Code Lists 1 to be imported for the running import session.
post.description: Adds Custom Code Lists 1 to be imported for the running import session. These entities will be placed in a staging database while the whole import process is running. Only after the import session is processed with the 'processImportedData' call, the staging entities will be placed in the real database and are then accessible for other services. A maximum of 50000 Custom Code Lists 1 can be imported into database.

204.description: Custom Code Lists 1 were successfully submitted for import during an import session identified by the provided sessionId

post.summary: Adds Custom Code Lists 2 to be imported for the running import session.
post.description: Adds Custom Code Lists 2 to be imported for the running import session. These entities will be placed in a staging database while the whole import process is running. Only after the import session is processed with the 'processImportedData' call, the staging entities will be placed in the real database and are then accessible for other services. A maximum of 50000 Custom Code Lists 2 can be imported into database.

204.description: Custom Code Lists 2 were successfully submitted for import during an import session identified by the provided sessionId

post.summary: Adds Custom Code Lists 3 to be imported for the running import session.
post.description: Adds Custom Code Lists 3 to be imported for the running import session. These entities will be placed in a staging database while the whole import process is running. Only after the import session is processed with the 'processImportedData' call, the staging entities will be placed in the real database and are then accessible for other services. A maximum of 50000 Custom Code Lists 3 can be imported into database.

204.description: Custom Code Lists 3 were successfully submitted for import during an import session identified by the provided sessionId

post.summary: Adds Custom Code Lists 4 to be imported for the running import session.
post.description: Adds Custom Code Lists 4 to be imported for the running import session. These entities will be placed in a staging database while the whole import process is running. Only after the import session is processed with the 'processImportedData' call, the staging entities will be placed in the real database and are then accessible for other services. A maximum of 50000 Custom Code Lists 4 can be imported into database.

204.description: Custom Code Lists 4 were successfully submitted for import during an import session identified by the provided sessionId

post.summary: Adds Custom Code Lists 5 to be imported for the running import session.
post.description: Adds Custom Code Lists 5 to be imported for the running import session. These entities will be placed in a staging database while the whole import process is running. Only after the import session is processed with the 'processImportedData' call, the staging entities will be placed in the real database and are then accessible for other services. A maximum of 50000 Custom Code Lists 5 can be imported into database.

204.description: Custom Code Lists 5 were successfully submitted for import during an import session identified by the provided sessionId

post.summary: Adds Plants to be imported for the running import session.
post.description: Adds Plants to be imported for the running import session. These entities will be placed in a staging database while the whole import process is running. Only after the import session is processed with the 'processImportedData' call, the staging entities will be placed in the real database and are then accessible for other services. A maximum of 1000 Plants can be imported into database.

204.description: Plants were successfully submitted for import during an import session identified by the provided sessionId

post.summary: Adds Product Groups to be imported for the running import session.
post.description: Adds Product Groups to be imported for the running import session. These entities will be placed in a staging database while the whole import process is running. Only after the import session is processed with the 'processImportedData' call, the staging entities will be placed in the real database and are then accessible for other services. A maximum of 1000 Product Groups can be imported into database.

204.description: Product Groups were successfully submitted for import during an import session identified by the provided sessionId

post.summary: Adds Product Structures to be imported for the running import session.
post.description: Adds Product Structures to be imported for the running import session. These entities will be placed in a staging database while the whole import process is running. Only after the import session is processed with the 'processImportedData' call, the staging entities will be placed in the real database and are then accessible for other services. A maximum of five unique access groups can be assigned to one product structure header. A maximum of 4000 Product Structures and 5000000 Product Structure Nodes can be imported into database.

204.description: Product Structures were successfully submitted for import during an import session identified by the provided sessionId

post.summary: Adds Products to be imported for the running import session.
post.description: Adds Products to be imported for the running import session. These entities will be placed in a staging database while the whole import process is running. Only after the import session is processed with the 'processImportedData' call, the staging entities will be placed in the real database and are then accessible for other services. A maximum of 400000 Products can be imported into database.

204.description: Products were successfully submitted for import during an import session identified by the provided sessionId

post.summary: Adds Subproject References to be imported for the running import session.
post.description: Adds Subproject References to be imported for the running import session. These entities will be placed in a staging database while the whole import process is running. Only after the import session is processed with the 'processImportedData' call, the staging entities will be placed in the real database and are then accessible for other services. A maximum of 15000 Subproject References can be imported into database.

204.description: Subproject references were successfully submitted for import during an import session identified by the provided sessionId

post.summary: Finishes the import process of all entites of one import session.
post.description: Finishes the import process of all entities to be imported that were previously sent through the corresponding service operations with the same session ID. After this operation is completed, the imported data is removed from the staging database and placed in the real database. From there on, the imported data is accessible from other services. The current status of this operation can be tracked via the service operation "/GetDataImportStatus". A maximum of 300000 staging records can be stored in staging database.

204.description: Successfully started the processing of the data that was sent during one import session, which is identified by its used sessionId.

get.summary: Retrieves the status of an import session using its session ID.
get.description: Retrieves the status of an import session using its session ID. The session status can be "In Progress", "Failed" or "Succeeded". This operation can only be used after the "/ProcessImportedData" operation was called for the corresponding session ID.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: UUID that is used during one import session and identifies exactly one import session.

post.description:
Group multiple requests into a single request payload, see [Batch Requests](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_BatchRequests).

*Please note that "Try it out" is not supported for this request.*

multipart/mixed;boundary=request-separat.example:
--request-separator
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

GET CustomCodeLists1 HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json


--request-separator--

multipart/mixed.example:
--response-separator
Content-Type: application/http

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{...}
--response-separator--

count.description: The number of entities in the collection. Available when using the [$count](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptioncount) query option.

OAuth2.description: To use this REST API, you need to get OAuth client credentials (client ID and secret) from SAP Cloud Platform using the cockpit. After that, you need to pass the obtained client credentials to the SAP Cloud Platform token endpoint to obtain an access token.

scopes.masterdata.read: Can read master data from the service.

top.name: $top
top.description: Show only the first n items, see [Paging - Top](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptiontop)

skip.name: $skip
skip.description: Skip the first n items, see [Paging - Skip](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionskip)

search.name: $search
search.description: Search items by search phrases, see [Searching](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionsearch)

error400.description: Bad Request: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error (e.g. malformed request syntax, size too large, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

error401.description: Unauthorized: The user does not have valid authentication credentials for the target resource.

error403.description: Forbidden: The request contained valid data and was understood by the server, but the server is refusing action. This may be due to the user not having the necessary permissions for a resource or needing an account of some sort, or attempting a prohibited action (e.g. creating a duplicate record where only one is allowed).

error404.description: Not Found: The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future. Subsequent requests by the client are permissible.

error405.description: Method Not Allowed: A request method is not supported for the requested resource; for example, a GET request on a form that requires data to be presented via POST, or a PUT request on a read-only resource.

error406.description: Not Acceptable: The requested resource is capable of generating only content not acceptable according to the Accept headers sent in the request.
